meanings.sent1: She gave a dismissive shrug when asked about the topic.
meanings.sent2: His dismissive attitude towards the project upset his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The cat's dismissive look at the new toy was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The dismissive way he waved off the suggestion left everyone stunned.
meanings.sent5: Her dismissive tone made it clear she didn't care at all.

meanings.definition: Dismissing or rejecting something without consideration
meanings.sent1: He would dismissively wave his hand whenever the idea was brought up.
meanings.sent2: They dismissively ignored the warning signs and faced the consequences.
meanings.sent3: The robot dismissively rejected all the faulty parts, causing chaos in the factory.
meanings.sent4: She dismissively tossed the letter aside, not bothering to read it.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dismissively marked the answer wrong without even checking.
